page.title: 09HAREWOOD HOUSE:RADIO 1 SHOW
page.content:
The "Teddy Bears' Picnic" was held on Easter Monday 1985, on the lawns in front of Harewood House.There were 8800 people, fewer than expected, because it rained.
Entry fees were Â£1.50 for adults and 50p for children.Proceeds went to the Variety Club of Britain.
Radio One was represented by the disc jockeys Peter Powell and Mike Read.Mike Read interviewed the Earl of Harewood and his wife.There was plenty of music from the current top forty singles chart, punctuated by small interviews with, and competitions for, spectators.The whole show was live on air and broadcast to the whole of Britain.
